sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Handwritten letter from Schenker to Moriz Violin, undated [?1897]
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: Schenker is unwell and advocates rest for both of them.

tei:opener.tei:salute: Lieber FlorizThis letter gives no clues as to date or place.

tei:div.tei:p: Ich bin richtig, wie ich mir selbst prophezeite, mässig erkrankt, habe etwas gefiebert, (nur Abenden) einen Rückfall in der Prostata mit als folge der Erkältung davongetragen. Ich bin schon seitdem 2mal bei Dr Schl.No candidates as medical doctors with these first four letters have so far come to light in the Schenker papers. gewesen, – endlich heute geht es besser. Jedoch pflege ich eisern der Ruhe, u. gedenke mich ganz in Ordnung zu bringen, um nicht immer wieder rückfällig zu werden.

I’m right: as I prophesized: moderately sick, have slight fevers (just in the evenings), a deterioration in the prostate, as a result of the cold that has cleared up. I have since been to see Dr. Schl. twice – finally today I feel better. However, I’m firmly in favor of rest, and mean to get myself into throughly good shape in order never again to have a relapse.

How are things with you? Likewise better, I hope? Now we are both slightly unwell. However, we both do very well on rest and isolation. You don’t need to bring an offering to visit me; it is totally unnecessary. Sadly, much as I would have liked to do, I’m unable to visit you.
